definition: adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack

sentences.english: Feints and stratagems are the stuff of chess.
sentences.chinese: 佯裝與計謀都是下象棋常耍的把戲。

sentences.english: Iron tiger and LAN such as sword rushed into the war room, pretend to take god valley of life.
sentences.chinese: 鐵虎和蘭如劍衝進作戰室，佯裝要取神谷性命。

sentences.english: A shoplifter was caught by the store clerks.
sentences.chinese: 一位佯裝顧客而偷竊貨品的人被店員逮到。

sentences.english: Should not immediately move line of sight away sprain face to one side pretend to be or to disappear.
sentences.chinese: 不可立刻把視線移開，或把臉扭向一邊，佯裝不見。

sentences.english: The cranes form a garland in the pretence of flight.
sentences.chinese: 仙鶴組成一道花環，佯裝着起飛。

sentences.english: Though he knew they were playing tricks on him, he pretended not to notice it.
sentences.chinese: 他心裏明白他們是在捉弄他，但他佯裝不知。

sentences.english: They would pretend to go away, leaving behind a small number of representatives.
sentences.chinese: 他們會佯裝離開，只留下少數代表。

sentences.english: He pretended not to know the facts.
Brutus pretended to be a friend of Julius Caesar, but he was actually a foe.
sentences.chinese: 布魯特斯佯裝是凱撒的朋友，但他其實是凱撒的敵人。

sentences.english: Instead of avoiding the change or pretending it doesn’t exist, deal with it—head on.
sentences.chinese: 不要逃避改變或佯裝變化不存在，而是迎頭應對改變。
